title: Alerts Not Working
text: Neither I, nor my husband receive alerts if a door is left open. It used to be the case that we would receive alerts if a garage door was left open. This would have come in handy last night since my husband left his door open. I checked in both the app and system settings to make sure alerts/notifications were enabled. Within the app the garage door state is reported correctly.

title: Beware!
text:
I’ve been a satisfied Garageio customer for many years now. Granted the Apple Watch app has always been buggy but the iPhone   app (which is your primary access point) has always been strong. All of a sudden, about 3mo ago, the app updated and I started getting logged out of the app quite often. I don’t have a clicker so Garageio is the only way for me to park in my garage. You can imagine was a hassle it is to have to log into the app several times a week as I’m driving up to my house and trying to park. I’ve notified Garageio of this issue and they say it’s a known issue and they are ‘working’ on it. It’s been months and I’ve seen no progress in resolving this issue. If you’ve just bought a Garageio, return it and wait for this know issue to be resolved.

*UPDATE*
I was contacted by Garageio customer support about a couple of months ago and told that the new software was available and this version should stop all the issues that I’ve been experiencing re: the app spontaneously logging me out. Well, unfortunately they were wrong. I still continue to get logged out at least a couple of times a week. I’ve brought this continued issue up w/ customer support yet again and I’ve heard nothing back. There are other options out there to integrate a garage door into your smart home. I think it’s time that I stop fighting my Garageio and let it RIP. I just wish I didn’t have to replace a perfectly functioning device all because of a poorly designed app!

title: Useful but needs improvements
text:
I’ve been using the app for years. Yes, there is an issue with being logged out occasionally (-1 ⭐️).  If your sensors are aligned properly, the system works. I’ve never had to reboot the thing and it has saved me numerous times from leaving my garage open. 

They may need to change the user swipe method for opening and closing the door. If your app is open and you swipe from the bottom up you may accidentally open or close the door. Not Garageio’s fault apple changed a core UX touch event.

title: Exactly what I was looking for
text:
Garagieo is the exact solution I was looking for. I needed a way to open my garage door without carrying a door opener and to this point, it has been reliable and completely functional. 

I have also created some Do buttons using IFTTT that allow me to operate my Garagieo with widget buttons, and I've integrated it with Amazon's Echo so Garageio is also integrated with voice controls in the house. 

After 1 month, it is operating flawlessly.

title: Has digital keys to give access to people
text: Garageio Has been very reliable for me for the past 5 years in my home. The key function is really what sets it apart from other d I can give out digital keys to house cleaners, nannies, etc and remove access when they no longer need it. Much better then making physical keys to give out

title: Time to move on
text: App is generally great, been using it for years, but push notifications have been broken for me since April so it’s not very useful anymore. Seems a common problem, and since Garageio was apparently bought by Beam Labs a couple years ago (their Beam Home app looks exactly like this app, even same version number scheme), I wouldn’t expect any more fixes or support. Plenty of great, cheap alternatives out there now.

title: Love Garageio
text: I have had my Garageio for 3 years now and I love it. As a grandparent, my Garageio works great to allow my grown children and grandchildren into the house when we are not home. We used to have a keypad but the keypad would always fail us during the cold winter months and overtime started not to work at all. I recommend this product.

title: So happy to see this app get some attention
text:
The log out bug was really driving me up the wall. But I was patient, figuring that eventually the developers would figure it out.

This really is a great and simple device for turning a dumb garage door into a smart home device.

Thanks for fixing the problem.

title: Software not quite ready
text:
For opening and closing the garage door with your phone garagio does great. The software has some glaring issues though that would have had me looking elsewhere had I been aware.

The software doesn't seem to check the status of the door properly, so you can't know by looking at the app if your door is opened or closed. Which is a major reason why someone would buy such a device. 

Second, you aren't notified in a change of status. Door opens or closes? You'll never know. Even with iffft integration it doesn't work. 

Lastly, you get a notification 30 minutes after your door had been left open. That's it, no automatic closing, no option for any other kind of notification, no adjusting the time. 

These guys have a great piece of hardware, they just need a development team that knows what to do with it.

title: Do Not Buy
text: I've had this device for two years. It only works less than half the time. It often gets unsynced (says the garage is open when it's not). Support keeps blaming my internet setup but I've changed three routers and had a tech expert check the connection. All other devices function normally on the network. Today I waited an hour before I could get in my house.  I am trashing mine now!  Total waste of money and it definitely does not do what it advertises!

title: Notifications stopped working
text: Been using this app for years (I was one of the first customers this company had) and after flawless performance for years it has failed me. The latest update messed up the notifications. My garage doors are now open without my knowledge. Having a detached garage this feature was the main reason I went with garageio. I hope this issue clears up soon.

title: Disappointed
text: After the last update I no longer stay logged in on my iOS devices both my watch and my phone. I now see that other users are having the same problem. I contacted support and was told an update would be provided and one update did come out but unfortunately they do not fix the issue. I’m currently in the process of removing garage up for my house. It’s a sad day to see such a great product to be tossed out.

title: App crashing after todays update
text:
UPDATE: Still no response from support. The device is basically a black brick in the garage and the app just a orange box on the phone now.

App crashes upon opening it. App support website not available as well. On clicking on support it keeps taking you to the home page

title: No longer reliable
text: Have had Garageio installed for several years.  Each app update is less stable.   Now it no longer works reliably with iPhone X. Or any version of iPhone X.   Your garage door opens/closes when you close the app!!!!!   Mine is now on the junk pile.  Developers don’t seem to have necessary resources to keep this working.

title: Notifications haven’t worked for over a year.
text: It never notifies anymore of the door is open. Just updated IOS to 13.6 and it just has the spinning circle in the app, can’t close or open doors. Not gonna bother contacting support, waste of time.

title: Don’t buy this product
text: There is no support. I stopped receiving notifications when my garage door is left open and I was told they are working on the issue. It’s been over a year now with no resolution.

title: Out of business
text: As of today, the company website does not load and the app does not load either. It looks like the company is completely out of business

title: Dead product. Sad
text: Loved this when it came out and for many years. The product, however, is dead. Nobody replies, year old updates, no support, parts take months.  Off to the landfill with it.

title: App needs serious updating
text:
I have to enter my password and re-login *every time* I open the app. iOS 11.2.2. Makes the watch app useless because the iPhone won't be logged in. 
Doesn't support iPhone X screen or FaceID.
Last app update was 1 yr ago. 
Their hardware is great. Please update the app!

title: FaceID
text:
I guess the app updated 3 months ago and I never realized they added FaceID. 
This is great!! Just need HomeKit integration via software now hopefully.

title: Great product!!
text: Really love the app easy to use, great customer support!!

title: No support
text: Over a week and radio silence since support request

title: Garbageio
text:
Update for version 3.0.8

Still garbage.  You can't cancel out of Touch ID.  Eventually the app will pitifully give up and crash.  Still won't connect to the system.  I've reset my box multiple times and the box will connect and be fine then disconnect itself after the app shows a successful connection or you use the app to open the door.  This all started after the 3.0.7 update so looks like your firmware is junk too now.  But how can you update the box if the app keeps crashing the connection. Let's try again with a new version asap or hey just put the old one back up that worked!!!!

----------
You took a perfectly good app that worked every time and destroyed it.  You should fire whatever kid you hired who probably still lives with his parents and doesn't even have a garage who had the great idea to ruin this app. The app won't even find my system.  The Touch ID goes into a death cycle that you can't even home screen out of.  You gave me an option to share garage door systems ... Why would I want to share my system!!!! If anything Invest in some analytics to gather some VOC.  This isn't a game app ... it's my garage!!! I don't want it to link to a spacebook page!!!! Bring back the last version now!!! And try for once testing your updates before releasing them. What BS part of the planet did you outsource to on this one?!  I'll give you one week to make the necessary changes before I tear your system out and put in a competitors.

title: Love the box, app works well but needs updates.
text: We love the Garageio box. It was easy to install has been working very well. We connected it to IFTTT so we can do things like automatically make sure the garage is closed in the evening.  The app does work and is functional, but it definitely feels like it needs an update. As an example it would be great to be able to have two garage is on the same screen. In addition he can get a notification when your garage was left open, but have to go into the app in order to close the garage. With current version of iOS, this seems like something that should be able to be done from the notification itself.

title: Money well spent!
text: I got the garageio garage door opener few days ago and works Great, easy to install & easy to program the app just make sure to carefully read and follow the instructions, I can open the garage door with my phone from anywhere  in the world my garage if need but ofcourse the idea is just to be able to have the garage door open few seconds before I arrive to my house and not wait for the door to open, the past I use gogo gate and I was very disappointed with the product, As a businessman I highly recommend this product.

title: Perfect Solution
text: Used on two car garage and works great and really responsive. Had some issues with push notifications but they appear to be working correctly now. Wife now says she never needs to wonder about garage door. Install can be a little time consuming based on number of doors and wires but I think this is best solution out there and handles all solutions from one to three car garage doors.

title: what happened?
text:
Used to work great. Now it won't connect to Apple watch anymore, and iphone shows door is up when it's down. I reloaded the iphone app and turned off the alerts, because it kept telling me the door was open. Ipnone still operates the door, but in the opposite direction. Alexa says she opens it, but no longer actually does.

It WAS  a great app/system. Now it is barely useable.

title: Love my Garageio!
text: Have you ever driven half a mile away from home and wondered, "Did I close the garage door?"  I have many times. I have also wasted time driving back to verify. Now that I have Garageio installed, I don't worry about it.  With an internet connection, I can see whether or not my door is open and can open or close it by a swipe of my finger.  Thanks Garageio.

title: Time reports
text: The updated app works as promised. And I use the list of door opening and closings as a way to make sure the door is closed by the kids in a timely fashion. Garageio has helped me close the door when I leave the house and forget.

title: Working again
text: After upgrading to ios8 on a 6 plus it wouldn't show my doors. Logging out and then back in crashed it. All subsequent appends failed. I deleted and re downloaded and it started working again.

title: Don't take over audio
text: Overall app works fine, however if I'm streaming music over Bluetooth in the car and use the app to open garage door, it takes over the audio stopping the music when there's no need for the app to do this

title: Nice update
text: Only one complaint. With Touch ID enabled, I get locked into a login loop if I accidentally open the app, or if I lock my phone with the app open and then unlock my phone. I'm forced to login before I'm allowed to exit the app. Wish I could just click cancel to kill the Touch ID prompt.

title: Works flawlessly
text: Love Garageio,  love the easy to use app.  Really glad you to see connectivity with ITTT.  Remote Open and Close Garage.  Built in notifications and with IFTTT now I can automate a function schedule with Garageio.  This product is awesome and easy to install.

title: Garageio rocks!
text: Works flawlessly!  Left my garage door open and Garageio alerted me in minutes, what a relief!  A friend called to borrow a tool while I was away on vacation. Thanks to Garageio I could let him in and then lock down the door. I love this feature.

title: Garage door control at its best
text:
I love this thing. Works flawlessly, lets me give access to family and use it from anywhere.
I can track all activity and set tones for alerts.

title: Efficient Apple Watch App
text: I have the two door Garageio and it's super convenient to be able to control my doors/receive notifications right from my Apple Watch!!

title: Very Simple but Interrupts Music
text: It is a minimal application. If you are listening to music or podcasts, it will stop your audio just so it can plan a sound effect when the door opens or closes. More notification and audio options would be ideal.

title: Awesome
text: Simple install, peace of mind knowing the garage door is closed. My son was in Sweden, he emailed me asking if he could test the Garageio. YES, it does work from anywhere in the world! More goodies coming from these guys soon. Made in America. All I can say is WOW!

title: Worked before upgrade to iPhone 6
text:
Not sure what has happened the app worked great until I upgraded to the iPhone 6. I don't believe it's io8, as the app worked fine on my iPhone 5 with iOS 8. 

Right now, it's totally useless to me. When they fix the issue, I will update my review.

title: Hello!?
text: This was a pretty good product until iOS 8. Won't work at all now. The company has never updated this app with some obvious simple tweaks. Won't respond to emails either. Did iOS 8 sneak up on you guys?  Please fix and update your product and I'll be your biggest supporter.

title: Love the Apple Watch app
text: Thank you for finally adding Apple Watch!!!!

title: Totally Broken Now
text: As soon as IOS10 is installed on your iphone/ipad the app stops working totally.  Its totally useless now.

title: Fix this!
text:
As with the other negative reviews, I’ve been having the same issues with the app logging me out every single time I use it! Since this been going on the last 5 months now, I can only think that the company doesn’t have the personnel to fix it??? I guess they’re not interested in keeping their customers happy. If I were in the market for an automated garage door opener, garageio would be at the bottom of the list. 

So frustrating!

Update 03/09/19 
The “log out” problem was fixed, but now the swipe up/down function works intermittently leaving the app and the technology utterly useless. 
What next?

title: Doesn't Work as Advertised
text:
My first Garageio worked for a few months, then went dead. I reached out to their tech support, and their solution was to send them the box, allow them a week or two to research it, then fix it, then they'll send it back. I pleaded with them to send me a new box, but they refused. After a long string of back and forth, they finally sent me a new box. 

The second Garageio box worked for a few months, and now it doesn't work at all. I've rebooted, reinstalled...everything. 

Tech support is poor. The device doesn't work as advertised.

title: Poorly Written App
text:
Update 2/18/2019
Yes!  Problem is resolved. Such a relief. Increasing my rating to 4 stars. The login issue is gone!  Thank you for recognizing the problem and fixing it!  It’s unfortunate it took so long, but all is well now. 

Original review:

Several times a week the app requires you to re-login. Driving up to my garage all I want to do is open the door, but have to sit at the entrance and renter my credentials then open the door. Would be faster to get out, go in the man door, open the garage and return to my car to drive it in. Customer service has known of the continued issue for months. Still no fix. 

My recommendation is to go with another solution. I’m about to throw away perfectly good hardware because Garageio can’t fix a bug in their software. Run far, far away, stay away from Garageio.

title: Dont buy and if you have return while you can
text:
Hi,

Very disappointed in this device.  It started to open spontaneously for no reason.  I purchased this device to make my garage smarter and home safer. However it has made my garage even dumber and my home less safe.

I called the company to report the issue and see if I could return it however they said I could not return it since it was purchased through Amazon. I contacted Amazon and they said it was too late to return.

These issues did not show up immediately while I was still able to return through Amazon. If you have purchased this I highly recommended you return it before you start having problems and it's too late to return.

Amazon was gracious enough to make an exception and except my return, probably because I purchased so many items through them. However I don't think most people would be as lucky.

title: Should be Zero
text: Waste of money. Tech support is unresponsive and now the pin code added to Alexa makes it too much trouble to integrate. Save your bucks. Something else hopefully comes along soon.

title: Nice update
text: I have been waiting for them to add TouchId or a pin code. It has both now.

title: Pin code is a great added level of security
text: Glad to see they're adding more security with the pin code option
